headline: Cabbage Steaks
description: Cabbage steaks are simple to prepare and easy to customize. They make a great side dish or vegetarian entree, baked to perfection in the oven.
name: Cabbage Steaks
recipeIngredient: 0.5 teaspoon ground black pepper, or to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Cut the bottom off of the cabbage and set it so the flat end is on the cutting board; cut into 1-inch thick slices. Arrange slices in a single layer in a large casserole dish.
Drizzle oil over cabbage slices and sprinkle with garlic. Season cabbage with salt and pepper. Cover the dish with aluminum foil.
Bake in the preheated oven until cabbage core is easily pierced with a fork, about 45 minutes.

review.reviewBody: I thought it was delicious. I added shredded cheese, since I saw so many similar recipes that added it. The cabbage steak was a really big serving though. Next time , I will try a smaller portion, so as not to waste any. The cheese was pretty but inconsequential. I will make this again.
The only change I made was to substitute Italian seasoning for the garlic powder--I'm very allergic to garlic. I love this recipe and will gladly make it again.
So very simple with good flavors making the cabbage the "star". Mine were done at 45 minutes.

I loved this recipe since I seen it a 2 years ago. I do cook it on 375 for 45 minutes and check it even so often because it doesn't cut alway at 1 inch. My husband loves them too and he is Mr Picky Eater. Yes, this is in my repertoire of recipes. P.S. Affordable too.
I used a bit more garlic. Easy excellent recipe

First of all, this recipe is 5 star as written. But I also like to change up the flavors occasionally and substitute sesame oil for the olive oil, gochugaru (Korean kimchi pepper) for the black pepper and drizzle with just a bit of rice vinegar to serve as a side to Asian inspired dishes. Both versions a favorite in our household!

I adjusted because I didnt have minced garlic so I used garlic powder, I increased the time to 1 hour, and I increased the temp to 375. I followed the directions exactly other than those three things. Came out yummy.
Easy and delicious. I didn't change a thing.

I am a 70-year-old man who does not consider him a cook, but I like to try new things. This was my first attempt with this recipe. I went overboard with the pepper and garlic, but it was still good. I added some grated Colby/cheddar cheese at the end of cooking. Next time I think I will try garlic powder instead of minced garlic.

Loved the idea but I added garlic powder, tyme,rosemary,dried chives,basil,a secret no salt recipe from my husband
( Chef Ed Strain Jr. ) I did this 5yrs ago to present
I never liked cabbage much thought give it a try tamest it out for my daughter and loved it

I use butter instead of olive oil, and actually season like a real steak with grillmates montreal steak seasoning, garlic powder, and a bit of Worcestershire sauce! Takes about 1:30-2 hours at 375! Yum!
Neither my husband or myself liked this recipe. I will not make this again.
Everybody Loved it. The cabbage had a sweet taste.
I wasn’t happy with the results of this dish. The flavor was unappealing, bland and temperature off too. I threw it out. A waste of time and ingredients, I definitely will not make this again.
This was great I love the flavor looks as good as it tastes after all we eat with our eyes first
I love how easy this is! ...and the garlic is an added bonus!

I Lovef this. Followed the recipe exactly except I used plan butter and lots more sliced garlic. While the cabbage was in the oven I made smoked lentils to serve with it. I can’t wait to make this again.
IT WAS GREAT !

Good way to make vegetables.

I substituted strips of bacon over the top for olive oil.
This was delicious. My husband even agreed, and he can be a pretty harsh critic when I try something new. I would definitely add this to the rotation.
I baked mine covers in foil, at 425 for 25 min, and it was completely cooked with nice roasted surface and a few blackened outer rings. Perfect. So try a higher temp if you don't have an hour!

Yes I did! I used salted Butter, seasoned both sides and wrapped steaks with a slice of bacon, added whole okra pieces. Covered the Glass dish with foil and baked for 45 minutes. on 350! It turned out perfect!
I just made this and it was absolutely delicious! I ate the entire cabbage head, but I don't feel guilty. Even my dog loved it and kept begging me for bites.
Delicious
Really enjoyed this recipe as a different option for cabbage (and as a substitute for meat).
Delish! So easy. Adjust garlic to your own taste.. the key is to cover with foil like recipe states which makes it turn out just right. Reheats well.
First time I made it I thought it was good. I had it the second time and decided its something that I would not want to have every month, jusi occasionally.

I made this in the Fall of 2019. In the Spring of 2020, coronavirus arrived and I had to make do with what I had. I came across my leftover cabbage steaks in the freezer and these ended up being invaluable, not to mention oh-so-delicious with everything I cleverly made with them. So, freeze leftovers! Don't waste and you won't be sorry!

My cabbage was cut around 1-inch thick so needed to cook about 55 minutes total. I LOVE a lot of flavor on my food so seasoned with a lot of garlic powder, “Seasoning for All the Things”, black pepper, and a little crushed red pepper. I also sprinkled some grated Parmesan over the top in the last 3-5 minutes of cooking, per another review. Delicious and so easy to make!
Turned out very tender and you can add any spice depending on your preference.

I cooked the recipe as instructed with salt, pepper, and drizzles of oil (Avocado oil from Sam - my favorite) on top of the cabbage cut in 1 inch slice. First time and now a Family favorite side dish. Next time I’ll spice it up with a different flavor!

When I tried to cut my cabbage into steaks it mostly fell apart into chunks, so I just chunked it all. I followed the recipe for ingredients and put the chopped cabbage on a shallow pan and roasted it for 20 minutes uncovered. Came out great.
Tasty!
I didn't like this at all.
This receipe is so enjoyable.
This is a pretty easy meal to make but it does take about an hour to cook. Our family loves cabbage and a little Parmesan Cheese and Sriracha sauce turns this into an awesome meal.
Do not cover with aluminum foil. 375 for 30 min each side.
Perfect just as the recipes . Thank you.
Made this just as the recipe said. It was delicious. I’ll be making this again soon!
love it i always add fresh sausage potato carrots onion.did chicken thighs n legs for the meat, was awesome!
Turned out perfect added three slices of bacon crumbled over the cabbage. Two thumbs up from my wife!

Not my cup of tea. Will try again, but will play with it when I do. I expected charred slightly and soft. Was not that. I maybe must come to terms with the possibility that I have grown old eating very overcooked cabbage and liking it. LOL thanks anyhow.
Wonderful! Great flavor and pretty easy to make!
Very simple and I added red pepper flakes. You can really make this your own but my entire family loved it!
Wanted to try something different with corned beef. This is a great recipe, will definitely use it again.
The more garlic, the better! I have made this several times and it gets better everytime.
I loved it.
I added some crushed red pepper and garlic powder. Yummy!

I will make this dish again. I didn't make any changes except I did have a small head of cabbage and I cut the steaks into smaller slices. It could have been less than a half inch. The cabbage was so small that it cooked a lot faster in just 25-minutes. I will try this again for my grand children and see what they think.
Very flavorful, great texture. Will definitely make this again.

I sliced mine about 1/2” . I followed the recipe except in regards to flavoring but in addition I also drizzled about a Tb total for 3 steaks I made on top of them as well as a little of seasoning called “Everything Bagel” I cooked them for 30 min. & the last 5 min I sprinkled w/ fresh Parmesan & cooked uncovered. These were so surprisingly good!
delicious and I added in green pepper onions and egg for breakfast over toast yummy
I brush a little balsamic vinegar and seasoned garlic salts on the top before I bake it. This is YUMMY and s-o-o-o very healthy.
Try different spices to your favorite flavors. These are really good!

1. Quick Excellent. Sprayed the glass baking pan with avocado baking spray, sliced about 1/2” and brushed on the olive oil. Sprinkled garlic powder, salt and pepper. Was good, the kids and husband liked it too!

Absolutely LOVE Cabbage Steaks!

We have made this many times since finding the recipe years ago it will always be one of our favorites.
yes Make some tonight!
I loved these. I was lazy and used garlic powder but they still came out great. I put them on rice and that was my meal.
Awesome dish! A change up from steamed cabbage.
Made this for St. Patrick's Day dinner, and the whole family loved it! Really flavorful.
It didn't have as much flavor as I would like, but I will make it again and cook longer.

Cut them about a half inch thick, 375 degrees, 45 minutes. Wow this is a great recipe. I am terrible at roasting vegetables and these turned out great. tender in the middle and crispy on the outside. I will make this again.
Amazing, I put honey on mine.
Love how this is simple and delicious! I'm always looking for ways to serve cabbage.
Made with the Venison Scaloppini (Amazing!) from this site so I opted for 40-45 mins @ 375 as well. Turned out great. Simple, economical and tasty!
great recipe for a very easy delicious side dish...1/2 hour on one side in 400º oven and flipped for another 1/2 hour... the charred pieces are the best. will make again and again...

I followed some suggestions and sprayed with olive oil, lots of minced garlic, then I used a brown sugar bourbon seasoning by McCormick and sprinkled with bacon pieces. Baked at 425 for 40 minutes. Delicious and a big hit with my dinner guests.
Excellent dish. Added can of Rotel tomatoes and bacon. 45 min covered - 15 uncovered. Added Italian cheese mix 5 min before pulling it out.
Loved these! I had too cook them about 20 minutes longer than the recipe says, though. I put a bit of butter on each steak, and cut the oil down to account for that. Will be making these again!

This was ok. I felt that the flavor of the seasoning was lost, I couldn't taste the seasoning even though I put on way more than the recipe called for. I cooked them 10 minutes longer than the recipe said. They didn't seem to be cooked all the way. I don't know maybe I cut them too thick. I really wanted to like this recipe because it was so easy. I will make it again but I will need to make some changes. Not sure what yet.

I was looking for a simple recipe to use up a whole head of cabbage that I didn't want to go to waste in the back of the fridge and this was amazing. I couldn't believe how wonderful this tasted. I'm definitely making this again.
I substituted Grape seed oil,instead of Olive oil. It was super,tasty. A must have more often recipe. Thank! Cheers!
delicious and healthy
This is amazing! So easy and tasty!! The only change I made was to sprinkle red pepper flakes on top for a little heat and some pretty color. Love this...it's a keeper!

Pretty tasty stuff. I followed the instructions exactly then topped my steak with some ahi which had marinated in sesame oil and soy sauce, gave it a squirt of lime, and it made a delicious and very filling lunch.

Pretty tasty stuff. I followed the instructions exactly then topped my steak with some ahi which had marinated in sesame oil and soy sauce, gave it a squirt of lime, and it made a delicious and very filling lunch.
Fast , easy and awesome! Of course the kids don't like it but for a VERY diet friendly side or snack this is genius!
I would give this ten stars if I could. My Husband and I like a little char around the edges
Delicious side dish and super easy! I only had leftover chopped cabbage so I mixed all the ingredients together and baked it that way. It was really tasty! Thank you!
Great on the grill - We like ours with the "char" and cook on nonstick foil.
Better than I thought! I did cook it higher at 380 for 50 minutes! Will definitely make it again!!
I have a pepper allergy so left it out, but still deliciouse

Tasty, but it must be cooked longer than the 45 minutes to soften the cabbage. I ended up cutting into smaller pieces and baking in the juices till it was tender. Will defenitely try again, but not in steaks.
I absolutely love this. I made it last week and I am making it again tonight. This is by far one of my new favorite dishes.
So simple and so tasty! Replaced oil with 1 tablespoon butter and added garlic seasoning. Cut thinner to 1/2 inch slices and was good to go in 35 min. Loved the charred edges. Great side dish!
My family loves, loves this recipe! So easy to prepare but yet so tasty. Thank you for sharing this recipe!
Wow, so easy and delicious.! Will definitely make this again. Followed recipe, no changes made.
I just need a better knife to make it easier to make thick slices.
Easy and delicious. Used kosher salt, pepper, and garlic powder.
Best Cabbage I have ever had, and my wife says it is the only cabbage she has ever actually liked! Thank you!
Very good! My husband couldn't get enough.
Easy to follow. Tasty. Will extend cooking time to at least 70 minutes.
so simple, easy and cheap!! Absolutely delicious!! Great healthy side dish or late snack....olive oil, fresh ground pepper and garlic salt is all I used. Made twice....
I love it , I used a little bacon grease , and Mrs. Dash on it, It was great, and served it with smoked sausage.

You know longer have to use a boiling pot with smoked meat to make a decent cabbage dish. It's very juicy and flavorful. I did leave it in longer to give it a little char which I liked a lot. Easy, healthy, and scrumptious!

I thought this was very good and easy, and I'm happy to know how to do it for when I have the oven on for something else. I only did one tonight in a pie pan in a small convection oven as I wasn't sure that I would like it, and that's all the room I had. It did take the listed 45 minutes so I should have done all of them in the big oven to be more efficient as I am sure they'd reheat well. I can do the rest of them tomorrow.
Awesome! The roasting brings out sweetness from the cabbage. Don't let it get too crispy!
I made this and it was simple, easy and delicious!
